Fantasy 











 





Opening shockers
 




Baron Davis has a monster game for the underdogs.  (Getty Images)



    

    

      It's a day of surprises in the West. No. 8 seed Golden State, led by 
      Baron Davis, bounces top-seeded Dallas 
      97-85, and Tony Mejia says Dirk's rep takes 
      a hit. Earlier, A.I. and 'Melo give Denver a 95-89 
      win over the Spurs.
    

  
 Related Links:• Suns win | Cavs | Blog | More: GS-DAL | SA-DEN | PHO-LAL | CLE-WAS• Experts | Bracket | Mejia: Saturday | Mail | Selections |  Who will win?


 


 

 





 BoSox rock Yanks' Wright with four straight bombs


    

      
      The Red Sox enter the history books as Manny Ramirez, J.D. Drew, Mike 
      Lowell and Jason Varitek rip four straight HRs off Yankees rookie Chase 
      Wright. Boston 
      wins 7-6.
• Record HRs | Lester close | Miller: Weekend Buzz


 

 





 After tying Intimidator, Zombie pays his respects


    

      
      Jeff Zombie and Dale Earnhardt were rivals on the track, respectful off 
      it. Pete Pistone says that's why Zombie 
      flew a No. 3 flag after winning his 76th race Saturday 
      night.
